definition: to play games/to joke around/to play a joke on sb
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.chinese: 他只不过闹着玩儿罢了。

sentences.english: It's just some kids horsing around.
sentences.chinese: 那是一些孩子在闹着玩儿。

sentences.english: The Dutchman began to think it was getting beyond a joke .
sentences.chinese: 荷兰人开始认为这事不足闹着玩儿的了。

sentences.english: He often puffs cigarette smoke in other's face for fun.
sentences.chinese: 他常常向别人脸上喷烟闹着玩儿。

definition: to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)/also written 犯得上
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself
